page.title: 09WILDLIFE IN THE AREA
page.content: {Ecology. Wildlife}in the area. -------------------------------------- The area consists of several villages,an RAF airfield and mixed farmland with grass and arable crops. Some land is open with few trees or hedges,other parts being heavily wooded.This area is cut by the River Witham,favoured by anglers.In addition there is a gravel pit used by Lincoln Board Sailing Club. Village:-{Birds:}blackbird, house sparrows,robins,starlings, cabbage white butterflies. Woodland:-kestrel,collared doves jays,bluetits,pigeons,pheasants and rabbits.{Trees}were mainly larch,oak, birch,hawthorn and rhododendron. Open and Riverside areas: lapwings,greenfinches,chaffinches, yellowhammer,swallows,damsel fly.Trees were mainly ash,oak and poplar.
